question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_remove_fee_coin_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [State Change Ordering] Does queue.remove_fee_type<T>() execute before or after event emission? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_remove_fee_coin_action.move] [Function: run()] [DoS Through Gas Exhaustion] Can an attacker with authority repeatedly call run<T>() with different types to exhaust gas or create excessive events, DoSing legitimate oracle operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_remove_fee_coin_action.move] [Function: run()] [Griefing Attack] Could a malicious authority holder remove all fee types to grief the protocol, forcing expensive re-additions or bricking the oracle queue? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_remove_fee_coin_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [No Active Feed Check] Can a fee type be removed while oracle feeds are actively using it for fee collection, causing broken invariants or lost fees? (High)
